chapters.title: Dusk
chapters.summary: Chapter 1 opens with an emotional scene at a morning assembly, where the principal, Mr. Bepo Adewale, is unable to speak due to visible distress. The narrative explores his struggles, the school’s financial concerns, and interpersonal conflicts among staff.

chapters.title: The Enticement
chapters.summary: Chapter 2 explores Mr. Bepo Adewale’s struggles with professional duties and family pressures as he contemplates an offer to join his family in the UK, highlighting tensions among staff and his deep commitment to Stardom Schools.

chapters.title: Migration Tales
chapters.summary: Chapter 3 examines migration trends in Nigeria, contrasting economic opportunities abroad with high living costs, and reflecting on the ethical and personal impacts of the mass exodus of professionals.

chapters.title: A Case of Visa Denied
chapters.summary: Chapter 4 centers on a visa denial case impacting a parent’s family, interweaving themes of trust, paternity revelations, and the moral dilemmas faced by Mr. Bepo as he balances confidentiality and justice.

chapters.title: Snake in the Roof
chapters.summary: Chapter 5 uses a literal snake incident at Stardom Schools to symbolize hidden conflicts and fear among staff, raising questions about transparency, professionalism, and management’s response.

chapters.title: Ade as Well as Jide COMES vs. COME
chapters.summary: Chapter 6 highlights the importance of competence and professionalism when a grammatical error sparks debate during Open Day, leading to a public lesson on accountability and linguistic precision.

chapters.title: Ritualists
chapters.summary: Chapter 7 explores fear and superstition as rumours of ritualists near the school disturb staff and students, examining how cultural beliefs influence behaviour and highlight the role of leadership in dispelling myths.

chapters.title: Missions Unaccomplished
chapters.summary: Chapter 8 reflects on unresolved disputes between pupils’ families and the prefect elections process, showcasing Mr. Bepo’s reflections on fairness, leadership challenges, and the impact of lingering conflicts.

chapters.title: Laughing Waterfalls
chapters.summary: Chapter 9 follows a school excursion to the Laughing Waterfalls, using the outdoor learning experience to foster teamwork, cultural appreciation, and student growth beyond classroom walls.

chapters.title: Passport Pains
chapters.summary: Chapter 10 delves into Mr. Bepo’s bureaucratic struggles with passport renewal, detailing the hurdles of service disruptions, agent fees, and the pressures of meeting travel deadlines.

chapters.title: Point of No Return
chapters.summary: Chapter 11 captures Mr. Bepo’s emotional journey as he prepares to leave Stardom Schools for the UK, reflecting on sacrifices, memories, and the irreversible nature of major life decisions.

chapters.title: ...Dawn
chapters.summary: Chapter 12 portrays Mr. Bepo’s final morning in Nigeria, focusing on farewells, cultural rituals, and his hopeful mindset as he embarks on a new chapter abroad.
